alert.note: Alert for Florence; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 6:08PM EDT until April 05 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN FLORENCE AND NORTHERN WILLIAMSBURG COUNTIES... At 608 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles east of Santee Cooper Regional Airport, or 9 miles southeast of Manning, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Lake City, Kingstree, Salters, Hebron, Cades, Indiantown, Scranton, Greeleyville, Lake City Community Hospital and Williamsburg Regional Hospital. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for northeastern South Carolina. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
